words.fact: Liquidity ratios measure a company's ability to pay short-term obligations. Examples include current ratio and quick ratio.
Solvency ratios measure long-term financial stability and ability to meet long-term obligations. Examples include debt-to-equity and interest coverage ratios.
Profitability ratios measure how efficiently a company generates profit. Examples include gross margin, operating margin, ROE, and ROA.
